title: May I ask a legitimate question concerning a rapture? To date no one has given me a logical answer and never one from the Word of God --- can you?
text:
By Truthseeker
Total:
May I ask a legitimate question concerning a rapture?  To date no one has given me a logical answer and never one from the Word of God --- can you?
Monday, January 22, 2018 14:24
% of readers think this story is Fact. Add your two cents.
 
 
 
 
Moses face shined so bright Moses had to wear a veil just from being near Jesus Christ on the mountain for 40 days and 40 nights..
Christ stated man, flesh and blood, can not be in the presents of God and live.
Thus raptured humans must be changed to spirit to be in the presents of Christ in heaven. The Third Heaven is a spiritual habitation. Spirit do not need food, water or air to live — they have LIFE in them.
So for those children still living with their parents  — the  question — are the children left behind or do they also go to heaven with their parents?
Flesh and blood can not go to heaven: which means children and even teenagers must be changed also to spirit before they can dwell in heaven.
Is God going to change a one year old child into a spirit being?
Will the child remain as a child or be instantly changed into an adult?
Does this mean these kids never have to be converted, never have to repent or be baptized or endure until the end?
This is a stumbling block to me—- no opinions please only scriptures confirming how God would handle this problem.

your household.
“Acts 16:31
1 Corinthians 7:14

AND
You asked….”Is God going to change a one year old child into a spirit being?”

in heaven…..IN HEAVEN …a CHANGED SPIRIT does not need
as you wrote….”Spirit do not need food, water or air to live — they have LIFE in them.”
You asked:…”Will the child remain as a child or be instantly changed into an adult?”
Insufficient detail in Scripture to know… However, avoid pointless discussions and ignorant questions when you know full well there are no details about this.
You asked….”Does this mean these kids never have to be converted, never have to repent or be baptized or endure until the end?”
For those alive the Rapture IS THE END of their endurance for those called to it, under 12yrs are Holy with A believing parent as per above Scriptures..and the dead in Christ endured to their end …NOT THE END as they died …
Adieu

The body of beliefs you hold are so discombobulated with one contradicting the next and the next making the next two impossible it truly demonstrates you are living up to your name.
